section.heading: Chief Advocate; qualification.

para.text: Be a resident of the District of Columbia within 180 days of appointment and shall remain a resident for the duration of the appointment;
Possess experience in outreach, advocacy, social work, law, or counseling; and
Have management experience that demonstrates the ability to hire and supervise qualified staff.

section.codify:annotation: Applicability of D.C. Law 20-76: § 401 of D.C. Law 20-76 provided that the change made to this section by § 203 of D.C. Law 20-76 is subject to the inclusion of the law’s fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan. Therefore that amendment has not been given effect.
Section 7008 of D.C. Act 22-130 repealed § 401 of D.C. Law 20-76. Therefore the changes made to this section by D.C. Law 20-76 have been given effect.
